Sisters (and pastry chefs) Stephanie and Andrea French have both talent and gumption, opening their first pint-size location in just nine days and surviving a fire that nearly ruined their new shop. Now The Pie Shoppe is busier than ever, sourcing thousands of pounds of British Columbian fruit to make their highly coveted pies.ORDER THE: salted honey with East Van honey and salt from Vancouver Island; chocolate peanut butter; and something seasonal, like the raspberry rhubarb or grapefruit and amaro custard.THE VIBE IS: serene, with light flooding in from both the front and back of the shop. There’s a long shelf filled with vinyls (courtesy of Mom and Dad French) and artful touches throughout from the sisters’ many crafty friends. But let’s be real: You’ll be spending most of your time hovering over all the latticed, sugar-crusted gems on the counter.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open Wednesday to Saturday, from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; and Sunday, from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Closed Monday and Tuesday. Need a whole pie?
